content.description: Sit start with opposing sidepulls and make a big move left hand to a sloper. Move your feet and toe hook out left to setup for another throw to a right hand sloper. From here bump the right hand to a crimp and make a hard move up to a good horn above the lip. Get a high foot and rock up to a knob or a jug slightly further away. Great movement.
content.location: This problem is located about 10-15 yards after the last buoy and slightly right. It has a short overhanging face that leads to a slab.

content.description: A classic slab with no holds and poor feet with a committing last move.
content.protection: A pad and a spot. Good technique.
content.location: The middle of the slab wall just right of "Vitality".

content.description: Sit start with the right hand on a low sidepull and the left hand on a sloper on the arete. Pull on and fire for the jug horn up and right or figure out some tricky foot beta like Jake Perry typically does.
content.location: This problem climbs the right arete of the "Vitality Boulder".

content.description: One of the hardest climbed slabs in Clough. This problem is technical and balancy.Stand start with two undercling on the obvious feature around waist height. Establish onto the wall and head straight up using some slopey holds and good technique.
content.location: This problem is found in between the obvious crack on the slab and the featureless center line "Vital Slab".

content.description: This boulder has a few great problems. From a slab with no hand holds to awkward and difficult sloping aretes, this boulder is bound to take up a few minutes of your time.
